commit_message:
Cleanup of Translations

In preparation for the release, do some cleanups for translations.

Removes all po files that are partially translated. The translation
team has decided to exclude files with less than 66 % of translated
content. There is no content lost, all data is in the translation
server, we just remove it from the repository.

This updates also recreates pot (translation source files) to
reflect the state of the repository in case there was no recent
import for them.

This change needs to be done manually since the automatic import does
not handle some of these cases.

Change-Id: I143c6255774c25d7d743e85276e65016c6c15b4d

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-24 18:47:45.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Disable devstack tests for kilo for Congress

During the kilo release, tempest tests were not run in the gate since they
did not run properly inside a virtual environment.  After kilo we began
gating on tempest tests.  Currently the tempest-test gate job applies
to all branches, meaning we can check nothing into kilo.

This change disables running tempest tests for stable/kilo.

Change-Id: Ibc5b651918d01637598ebd62c818ff34d8a2246d
'}]
commit_message:
Disable devstack tests for kilo for Congress

During the kilo release, tempest tests were not run in the gate since they
did not run properly inside a virtual environment.  After kilo we began
gating on tempest tests.  Currently the tempest-test gate job applies
to all branches, meaning we can check nothing into kilo.

This change disables running tempest tests for stable/kilo.

Change-Id: Ibc5b651918d01637598ebd62c818ff34d8a2246d

commit_message:
Cleanup of Translations

In preparation for the release, do some cleanups for translations.

Removes all po files that are partially translated. The translation
team has decided to exclude files with less than 66 % of translated
content. There is no content lost, all data is in the translation
server, we just remove it from the repository.

This updates also recreates all pot (translation source files) to
reflect the state of the repository.

This change needs to be done manually since the automatic import does
not handle some of these cases.

commit_message:
Add migrate abort and migrate recover support

If the migration operation exceeds the configured time, abort the migration operation.
If migration abort also fails consider it as the migration fail and invoke the rollback
and recover the migration.

Closes-Bug: 1498551
Change-Id: Ia973eafaf6b6ef647b455ff82af0eb2f23e054ad

commit_message:
Load Neutron plugins before extension manager

If the PluginAwareExtensionManager is instantiated before the neutron core
plugin is loaded, neutron-*aas service plugins will fail to load.  This loads
the neutron core plugin first before the PluginAwareExtensionManager.  It's
not ideal, but will do for now.

Change-Id: I60594f8be4e48ee79934644ab5db9cae8b3577ab

subject: os-net-config: ensure ifup is called just once
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-17 15:00:40.000000000', 'files': ['os_net_config/tests/test_impl_ifcfg.py', 'os_net_config/impl_ifcfg.py'], 'message': 'os-net-config: ensure ifup is called just once

This patch fixes an issue in the ifcfg provider implementation
that caused interfaces to be started twice. This can
cause failures if the interface uses DHCP and dhclient
was already running.

The child_members function was incorrectly adding the interface
name to the child members set on key error. This patch removes
that logic and simply ignores key errors.

Change-Id: Ibe0e32bc09979bc68b92a722b2bfa383e77502a9
Closes-bug: #1485634
'}]
commit_message:
os-net-config: ensure ifup is called just once

This patch fixes an issue in the ifcfg provider implementation
that caused interfaces to be started twice. This can
cause failures if the interface uses DHCP and dhclient
was already running.

The child_members function was incorrectly adding the interface
name to the child members set on key error. This patch removes
that logic and simply ignores key errors.

Change-Id: Ibe0e32bc09979bc68b92a722b2bfa383e77502a9
Closes-bug: #1485634

subject: Remove quotes from subshell call in bash script
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-23 12:09:35.000000000', 'files': ['bin/barbican.sh'], 'message': 'Remove quotes from subshell call in bash script

Always no quotes for $() statement.

We don't need quotes to hold blanks in result:
 # i=$(echo 1 2 3)
 # echo $i
 1 2 3
 #

These quotes can make something wrong in some case:
 # i=$(echo '!')
 #
 # i="$(echo '!')"
 -bash: !: event not found
 #

No real problem for current code, only to use a better code style.

Change-Id: I865069a1aa0384d13feed7249cadb2f34b6cf99d
Signed-off-by: Zhao Lei <zhaolei@cn.fujitsu.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Remove quotes from subshell call in bash script

Always no quotes for $() statement.

We don't need quotes to hold blanks in result:
 # i=$(echo 1 2 3)
 # echo $i
 1 2 3
 #

These quotes can make something wrong in some case:
 # i=$(echo '!')
 #
 # i="$(echo '!')"
 -bash: !: event not found
 #

No real problem for current code, only to use a better code style.

Change-Id: I865069a1aa0384d13feed7249cadb2f34b6cf99d
Signed-off-by: Zhao Lei <zhaolei@cn.fujitsu.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-09-23 11:24:04.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Use --max-complexity flake8 rule

This feature is quite useful to detect over-complex code. According to
McCabe, anything that goes beyond 10 is too complex. See
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cyclomatic_complexity.

Currently the max complexity is 13:

    ./magnum/service/periodic.py:51:1: C901 'MagnumPeriodicTasks.sync_bay_status' is too complex (11)
    ./magnum/conductor/handlers/bay_conductor.py:220:1: C901 'HeatPoller.poll_and_check' is too complex (12)
    ./magnum/common/magnum_keystoneclient.py:97:1: C901 'KeystoneClientV3._v3_client_init' is too complex (10)
    ./magnum/common/exception.py:192:1: C901 'MagnumException.__init__' is too complex (10)
    ./magnum/common/utils.py:335:1: C901 'temporary_mutation' is too complex (12)
    ./magnum/db/sqlalchemy/api.py:125:1: C901 'Connection._add_bays_filters' is too complex (13)
    ./magnum/db/sqlalchemy/api.py:295:1: C901 'Connection._add_baymodels_filters' is too complex (12)

Setting the max complexity to 14 allows us to not produce anything more
complex. We can work on reducing our complex functions and reducing this
number to 10.

Change-Id: Iaf9c87ecb4873e646d952fd892aafeb7c91fb5e5
Closes-Bug: #1498872
"}]
commit_message:
Use --max-complexity flake8 rule

This feature is quite useful to detect over-complex code. According to
McCabe, anything that goes beyond 10 is too complex. See
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cyclomatic_complexity.

Currently the max complexity is 13:

    ./magnum/service/periodic.py:51:1: C901 'MagnumPeriodicTasks.sync_bay_status' is too complex (11)
    ./magnum/conductor/handlers/bay_conductor.py:220:1: C901 'HeatPoller.poll_and_check' is too complex (12)
    ./magnum/common/magnum_keystoneclient.py:97:1: C901 'KeystoneClientV3._v3_client_init' is too complex (10)
    ./magnum/common/exception.py:192:1: C901 'MagnumException.__init__' is too complex (10)
    ./magnum/common/utils.py:335:1: C901 'temporary_mutation' is too complex (12)
    ./magnum/db/sqlalchemy/api.py:125:1: C901 'Connection._add_bays_filters' is too complex (13)
    ./magnum/db/sqlalchemy/api.py:295:1: C901 'Connection._add_baymodels_filters' is too complex (12)

Setting the max complexity to 14 allows us to not produce anything more
complex. We can work on reducing our complex functions and reducing this
number to 10.

Change-Id: Iaf9c87ecb4873e646d952fd892aafeb7c91fb5e5
Closes-Bug: #1498872

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-23 23:53:54.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/coordination.py', 'ceilometer/tests/test_coordination.py'], 'message': 'Coordinator handles ToozError when joining group

While joining partitioning group, we check for
MemberAlreadyExist and GroupNotCreated, but fail
to account for connection failure scenarios. This
leads to ugly stack trace in notification agent logs
and bails out before configuring the notification
and pipeline listeners.

This fix handles the ToozError exception and logs
an error message before retrying the join, assuming
that the error was a temporary problem.

Change-Id: I2aed2241ded798464089b3eec5e1394422a45844
Closes-Bug: 1496982
(cherry picked from commit 09d9325ddf084173c06bc52009ffd48a92d39503)
'}]
commit_message:
Coordinator handles ToozError when joining group

While joining partitioning group, we check for
MemberAlreadyExist and GroupNotCreated, but fail
to account for connection failure scenarios. This
leads to ugly stack trace in notification agent logs
and bails out before configuring the notification
and pipeline listeners.

This fix handles the ToozError exception and logs
an error message before retrying the join, assuming
that the error was a temporary problem.

Change-Id: I2aed2241ded798464089b3eec5e1394422a45844
Closes-Bug: 1496982
(cherry picked from commit 09d9325ddf084173c06bc52009ffd48a92d39503)

on a clean install to avoid conflicting devstack dependency config problems.

commit_message:
Use of 'the Bare Metal service' in guide

All our documentation pertain to the Bare Metal service, so that
string is removed from the heading (unless we want to be consistent
and put that in all our pages). Removing that also allows us to avoid
the question of of whether it is 'The Bare Metal service <whatever>'
vs. 'Bare Metal service <whatever>' vs.
'Bare Metal Service <whatever>' vs... (you get the picture).

Also fixes another instance where 'the Bare Metal service' wasn't
correctly used.

Change-Id: I69c5ae672c28e8984fb5da6423e458b564d26d13

subject: [Murano-Apps] Fix Rally deployment by Murano
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-24 16:26:04.000000000', 'files': ['install_rally.sh'], 'message': "[Murano-Apps] Fix Rally deployment by Murano

This small patch fixes a bug in install_rally.sh, which actually
was caught in Murano.

While installing Rally, script updates PIP, so new pip location
can differ from previous one, but bash cache is unchanged, so
bash fails to run `pip' and installation fails.

Change-Id: I3bd92258c6eb29f965a977f3d3e6034cb2bd3754
Closes-Bug: #1490586
"}]
commit_message:
[Murano-Apps] Fix Rally deployment by Murano

This small patch fixes a bug in install_rally.sh, which actually
was caught in Murano.

While installing Rally, script updates PIP, so new pip location
can differ from previous one, but bash cache is unchanged, so
bash fails to run `pip' and installation fails.

Change-Id: I3bd92258c6eb29f965a977f3d3e6034cb2bd3754
Closes-Bug: #1490586

subject: Use raw data for inline edits of boolean fields
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-16 14:30:15.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/tables/base.py'], 'message': 'Use raw data for inline edits of boolean fields

Boolean fields use filters to turn the True/False values into Yes/No
but this makes the inline edit checkbox always checked. This patch
will use the raw data for the cell when setting the value for the
inline edit checkbox so that it is correctly checked or not checked.

Closes-Bug: #1496417
Change-Id: I9edb0a1d1b88b918ba334393c44e8389f6c785a4
'}]
commit_message:
Use raw data for inline edits of boolean fields

Boolean fields use filters to turn the True/False values into Yes/No
but this makes the inline edit checkbox always checked. This patch
will use the raw data for the cell when setting the value for the
inline edit checkbox so that it is correctly checked or not checked.

Closes-Bug: #1496417
Change-Id: I9edb0a1d1b88b918ba334393c44e8389f6c785a4

commit_message:
Use explicit version of image client in gates

DevStack uses v2 version for openstack image client, but
this version doesn't support --property as well.
So, let's use v1 version for registering image for Sahara.

Closes-bug: 1499309
Change-Id: Iec6aa6b42e5575690631fed585eaa8d6ff2501a1

commit_message:
Bug-Fix for unexpected DHCP agent redundant

This fix let DHCP scheduler not looks at only active agents, but all
available agents.
This helps db module to remove dead agent, when rebinding, properly.

Change-Id: I8534ddfae299724c05641183c2fe4c1c98c614e8
Closes-Bug: 1388698
(cherry picked from commit b095fa11a4df221a5d539d142bd3c0340935ad9d)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-24 14:37:54.000000000', 'files': ['nova/volume/cinder.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Deprecate cinder.cross_az_attach option"

This reverts commit d8d2f02f3014e8d7e0ef9a61723f5a10f050cc81

The deprecation change was merged before operators had a
chance to weigh in and it turns out that at least one large
operator relies on this option for isolating VMs and volumes
to the same availability zones.

There are still a lot of issues around the usage of this
option and the tightly coupled interaction between nova
and cinder with respect to availability zones.  We need
to better document this option and how it's used which
will come in a follow up change.

We also need to address the usability issues around this
when doing a boot from volume where source != volume,
because right now the failure happens when building the
VM and that results in a NoValidHost error for the user
if they didn't specify the request correctly or their
admin doesn't have the cloud configured correctly.

Ultimately there is a lot of API policy defined between
this option and the allow_availability_zone_fallback
option in cinder and that's hidden from the user. So there
will probably also be a follow up change to add validation
in the compute API in the boot from volume case where
source != volume and cinder.cross_az_attach=False so
we can attempt to fail fast with a 400 response rather
than get to the compute node and fail the build.

There is related discussion in the mailing list here:

https://www.mail-archive.com/openstack-dev@lists.openstack.org/msg64179.html

Change-Id: Ia6c8200286242d637f409ce0e65d906b5ce4b952
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Deprecate cinder.cross_az_attach option"

This reverts commit d8d2f02f3014e8d7e0ef9a61723f5a10f050cc81

The deprecation change was merged before operators had a
chance to weigh in and it turns out that at least one large
operator relies on this option for isolating VMs and volumes
to the same availability zones.

There are still a lot of issues around the usage of this
option and the tightly coupled interaction between nova
and cinder with respect to availability zones.  We need
to better document this option and how it's used which
will come in a follow up change.

We also need to address the usability issues around this
when doing a boot from volume where source != volume,
because right now the failure happens when building the
VM and that results in a NoValidHost error for the user
if they didn't specify the request correctly or their
admin doesn't have the cloud configured correctly.

Ultimately there is a lot of API policy defined between
this option and the allow_availability_zone_fallback
option in cinder and that's hidden from the user. So there
will probably also be a follow up change to add validation
in the compute API in the boot from volume case where
source != volume and cinder.cross_az_attach=False so
we can attempt to fail fast with a 400 response rather
than get to the compute node and fail the build.

There is related discussion in the mailing list here:

https://www.mail-archive.com/openstack-dev@lists.openstack.org/msg64179.html

Change-Id: Ia6c8200286242d637f409ce0e65d906b5ce4b952

commit_message:
Don't write DHCP opts for SLAAC entries

Change I81b4669eadaa9119e08c6a5e1d2a7b5959babdcc
caused DHCP options to be written for SLAAC entries
when they previously were not. This restores the previous
behavior.

Closes-Bug: #1499054

commit_message:
Fix quota usage tracker for security group rules

This simple patch ensures usage for security group rules is
marked as dirty when a security group rule is deleted.
To this aim, the security group rule is deleted using ORM
in order to ensure the sqlalchemy even if fired.

Closes-Bug: #1499339

Change-Id: I1e81fe03fed14ec438cea5d7675f66caeb91afd8

commit_message:
Use a standard hostname to prevent setting invalid hostnames.

It's possible for a tenant to change their router's name to something that's
not a valid hostname.  This uses a standard ak-<tenant-uuid> value that we can
rely on.

Change-Id: Id64f7c796f8ef01200f51494611458b5731149c8
Fixes-bug: #1496848
(cherry picked from commit 760df4839ef2f97a6825f852b87556569c6c03c7)

commit_message:
Set upper boundary for python-ceilometerclient

Set upper boundary for python-ceilometerclient with version of the
package contained in fuel-infra repositories. This eliminates the issue
with dependency conflicts but is not permanent solution.

Dependency conflicts are due to dyssynchrony of the package versions
from the OpenStack global requirements and packages contained in our
repository.

Change-Id: I46ddb3094bcf39ffdd72279b801176d7733d222d
Closes-Bug: #1498934

commit_message:
Trap exceptions in helper functions

os-client-config can bubble up a keystoneauth1 error now since that's
where auth plugin parameter validation happens. However, consumers of
the helper functions will not be expecting such a thing as the helper
function is hiding the sequence from them.

Change-Id: I84ececc71764b3f345b0d507d419260aef720783

subject: Install RabbitMQ 3.5.4 on Ubuntu systems
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-09-24 17:37:18.000000000', 'files': ['install_modules.sh'], 'message': "Install RabbitMQ 3.5.4 on Ubuntu systems

RabbitMQ 3.5.5 has a bug [1] that prevent puppetlabs-rabbitmq module to
create permissions:

Could not evaluate: cannot parse line from
list_user_permissions:/usr/sbin/rabbitmqctl: 19: [: Linux: unexpected
operator]

This patch is a workaround to make sure we install the previous stable
version of RabbitMQ (3.5.4). Since puppetlabs-rabbitmq module will only
check if the package is 'installed', it won't try to update it.

[1] https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server/issues/321

Change-Id: I8e0fa8e62e93b62317011fd7c8a2730cd293d4c7
"}]
commit_message:
Install RabbitMQ 3.5.4 on Ubuntu systems

RabbitMQ 3.5.5 has a bug [1] that prevent puppetlabs-rabbitmq module to
create permissions:

Could not evaluate: cannot parse line from
list_user_permissions:/usr/sbin/rabbitmqctl: 19: [: Linux: unexpected
operator]

This patch is a workaround to make sure we install the previous stable
version of RabbitMQ (3.5.4). Since puppetlabs-rabbitmq module will only
check if the package is 'installed', it won't try to update it.

[1] https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server/issues/321

Change-Id: I8e0fa8e62e93b62317011fd7c8a2730cd293d4c7

subject: Bump pbr to 1.8
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-23 13:15:12.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Bump pbr to 1.8

Currently, we have global-requirements.txt with pbr >= 1.6, but
setup.py has >= 1.8. As a consequence, many packages have a
simply wrong requirements.txt, as the proposal bot gives bad
advices. For example:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/224618/

The consequence can be that pbr gets downloaded during the
clean target, which is bad (this fails package building in
some cases, like with a pbuild / sbuild).

So, the best way forward to fix this bad situation, is IMO
to bump pbr to 1.8 right now. I don't think it's a problem for
downstream distributions anyway (it's not for me in Debian at
least...).

Change-Id: I7a70beaf5312f2436ca182fcaaadabff7cf9cf48
"}]
commit_message:
Bump pbr to 1.8

Currently, we have global-requirements.txt with pbr >= 1.6, but
setup.py has >= 1.8. As a consequence, many packages have a
simply wrong requirements.txt, as the proposal bot gives bad
advices. For example:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/224618/

The consequence can be that pbr gets downloaded during the
clean target, which is bad (this fails package building in
some cases, like with a pbuild / sbuild).

So, the best way forward to fix this bad situation, is IMO
to bump pbr to 1.8 right now. I don't think it's a problem for
downstream distributions anyway (it's not for me in Debian at
least...).

Change-Id: I7a70beaf5312f2436ca182fcaaadabff7cf9cf48

commit_message:
Pin RabbitMQ 3.5.4 on Ubuntu systems

RabbitMQ 3.5.5 has a bug [1] that prevent puppetlabs-rabbitmq module to
create permissions:

Could not evaluate: cannot parse line from
list_user_permissions:/usr/sbin/rabbitmqctl: 19: [: Linux: unexpected
operator]

This patch is a workaround to make sure we install the previous stable
version of RabbitMQ (3.5.4).

[1] https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server/issues/321

Change-Id: I33e61f3680edb39117a3ed4f307c1d6d9b72a200

commit_message:
No longer need to disable libvirt default network

Starting with the libvirt packages, the default network is no longer
persistent, so trying to disable autostart for it fails. Destroying the
network will still work without that.

Change-Id: Ie9f95d161708cbe8a1d7af2a4518b8c82f491592

subject: Switch json to oslo_serialization for token_client
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-09-03 06:15:43.000000000', 'files': ['tempest_lib/services/identity/v3/token_client.py', 'tempest_lib/common/rest_client.py', 'tempest_lib/services/identity/v2/token_client.py'], 'message': 'Switch json to oslo_serialization for token_client

During the service client development, we have switched json import
to oslo_serialization on Tempest side.
token_client modules were migrated before that, and they still import
json module.
This patch switches to oslo_serialization for token_client modules.
In addition, an internal method _json_loads() of RestClient is not
used with the above change. So this patch removes _json_loads().

Change-Id: I4c731b2ce35c4fb85904cab89dbe943ae95b3b52
'}]
commit_message:
Switch json to oslo_serialization for token_client

During the service client development, we have switched json import
to oslo_serialization on Tempest side.
token_client modules were migrated before that, and they still import
json module.
This patch switches to oslo_serialization for token_client modules.
In addition, an internal method _json_loads() of RestClient is not
used with the above change. So this patch removes _json_loads().

Change-Id: I4c731b2ce35c4fb85904cab89dbe943ae95b3b52

subject: Add database commit for database writes when async operations are possible
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-24 04:54:30.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/tests/plugin/interface/test_certificate_manager.py', 'barbican/common/quota.py', 'barbican/plugin/interface/certificate_manager.py'], 'message': 'Add database commit for database writes when async operations are possible

If we expect a database read to arrive asynchronously on a different
thread than a database write, then any changes from the write should
be explicitly committed to the database.

Change-Id: I23ccdb2bf33b1a2d910f71b985f8a86da3824267
Closes-bug: #1499105
'}]
commit_message:
Add database commit for database writes when async operations are possible

If we expect a database read to arrive asynchronously on a different
thread than a database write, then any changes from the write should
be explicitly committed to the database.

Change-Id: I23ccdb2bf33b1a2d910f71b985f8a86da3824267
Closes-bug: #1499105

commit_message:
Continue fixing Octavia complexity issues

This is for fixing the octavia issue.
We ran the Octavia code base through a static code analyser and several issues got flagged.
As an exercise we looked at each issue and are now proposing fixes to the complexity/code style issues.

Change-Id: I013af7240f608300b7432804edb20d8f9190f61c

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-24 16:56:03.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/token/providers/common.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_auth.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/token/test_fernet_provider.py'], 'message': "Allow Fernet to return TokenNotFound

We've been working towards consolidating the Fernet token provider into the
common.BaseProvider() class. A previous commit did this:

  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/196877/

But we missed one detail from the fernet.core.Provider that didn't get included
in the commit, which is returning exception.TokenNotFound instead of a
validation error. This commit introduces that logic into the BaseProvider so
that it is consistent with what was originally implemented.

Change-Id: I4bb52c61bba4da172ccdab040ec2d99c85c093e8
"}]
commit_message:
Allow Fernet to return TokenNotFound

We've been working towards consolidating the Fernet token provider into the
common.BaseProvider() class. A previous commit did this:

  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/196877/

But we missed one detail from the fernet.core.Provider that didn't get included
in the commit, which is returning exception.TokenNotFound instead of a
validation error. This commit introduces that logic into the BaseProvider so
that it is consistent with what was originally implemented.

Change-Id: I4bb52c61bba4da172ccdab040ec2d99c85c093e8

commit_message:
Add --verbose to subset of cmds in neutron-db-manage

This commit updates neutron/db/migration/cli.py such that --verbose can
be passed to the following commands:

- current
- history
- branches

We also update tests in neutron/tests/unit/db/test_migration.py and add
a new test for 'neutron-db-manage branches' as that appears to be
untested.

Lastly, we add a brief description of the newly added capability to
doc/source/devref/alembic_migrations.rst.

Change-Id: I9fc136055b422f12a22c1365f52f17df53219820
Closes-Bug: #1488021

commit_message:
Correct comment to not be driver-specific

The comment mentioned Fernet tokens specifically, but the situation
is going to apply any time the driver doesn't persist the token.
The manager is common code and shouldn't depend on the driver.

Change-Id: I21c104b6256d9718c233d0f44d4c06c5a1ace6c9

patch updates the NetApp Cinder drivers to use the new library.

and ZAPI interface code that the driver references.
This code was previously part of the driver code tree in
Cinder: netapp/dataontap/client/api.py and netapp/eseries/client.py.
This patchset removes the relevant code from these files
and also modifies the unit tests to work in the absence
of the new library.

Implements: blueprint netapp-use-pypi-client-library

Change-Id: If51c13ade0497c8e89b044bebb393b52da62029a
'}]
commit_message:
Update NetApp Drivers to use netapp_lib

Like other vendors, NetApp has published a storage controller
client library to PyPI for use by its OpenStack drivers. This
patch updates the NetApp Cinder drivers to use the new library.

The new library, when downloaded from PyPI, provides the REST
and ZAPI interface code that the driver references.
This code was previously part of the driver code tree in
Cinder: netapp/dataontap/client/api.py and netapp/eseries/client.py.
This patchset removes the relevant code from these files
and also modifies the unit tests to work in the absence
of the new library.

Implements: blueprint netapp-use-pypi-client-library

Change-Id: If51c13ade0497c8e89b044bebb393b52da62029a

commit_message:
Add faceting

Add faceting support. Adds /search/facets to the endpoints which returns
a mapping {resource_type: [{"name": "..", "type": ".."}, ..], .. }

Includes an internal change to plugins to allow each plugin's RBAC
filters to be reused.

Change-Id: I25fdc58dc26c168766c0ff10844e64f4c0c2bb79
Implements: blueprint field-faceting

commit_message:
Add Shared File Systems (manila) to Config Ref

Shared File Systems service (manila) should be added to
the Config Ref similar to Block Storage (cinder).
The content would be similar to cinder in that it
would have sections to describe Intro, Drivers,
Log Files and Options.

Change-Id: I89fc64f8cd4fe880b36017139e7989f3a4100cc6
Implements: blueprint manila-config-ref

commit_message:

subject: Add a new script that queries for a Zanata version
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-24 06:33:45.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/query-zanata-project-version.py', 'jenkins/scripts/upstream_translation_update.sh'], 'message': "Add a new script that queries for a Zanata version

To allow us to check if a version exists for a Zanata project without
requiring us to create a zanata.xml first, add a small script that
uses the Zanata REST API to query for its existance.

Make use it instead of the zanata-cli in upstream_translation_update,
since we can't create a zanata.xml if the version doesn't exist.

Change-Id: I93a72845aa705ce6b72acec9b5d62b5565368ab0
"}]
commit_message:
Add a new script that queries for a Zanata version

To allow us to check if a version exists for a Zanata project without
requiring us to create a zanata.xml first, add a small script that
uses the Zanata REST API to query for its existance.

Make use it instead of the zanata-cli in upstream_translation_update,
since we can't create a zanata.xml if the version doesn't exist.

Change-Id: I93a72845aa705ce6b72acec9b5d62b5565368ab0

subject: Remove quotes from subshell call in bash script
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-23 12:07:56.000000000', 'files': ['tools/update_states.sh'], 'message': 'Remove quotes from subshell call in bash script

Always no quotes for $() statement.

We don't need quotes to hold blanks in result:
 # i=$(echo 1 2 3)
 # echo $i
 1 2 3
 #

These quotes can make something wrong in some case:
 # i=$(echo '!')
 #
 # i="$(echo '!')"
 -bash: !: event not found
 #

No real problem for current code, only to use a better code style.

Change-Id: I0f43bb936f956c99603dc15aaad9db851ecf0acd
Signed-off-by: Zhao Lei <zhaolei@cn.fujitsu.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Remove quotes from subshell call in bash script

Always no quotes for $() statement.

We don't need quotes to hold blanks in result:
 # i=$(echo 1 2 3)
 # echo $i
 1 2 3
 #

These quotes can make something wrong in some case:
 # i=$(echo '!')
 #
 # i="$(echo '!')"
 -bash: !: event not found
 #

No real problem for current code, only to use a better code style.

Change-Id: I0f43bb936f956c99603dc15aaad9db851ecf0acd
Signed-off-by: Zhao Lei <zhaolei@cn.fujitsu.com>

commit_message:
make nova v2.0 compat jobs voting

These jobs only exist in the check queue because they are only run on 
Nova changes. If there happens to be an extremely rare odd merge that
causes these to fail, it can be fixed easily in the Nova tree after.

Change-Id: I5a329211403108eb17b77f247d2b1de1e9ba20ff

commit_message:
Support IPA in raid_device plugin

IPA does not send block_devices. Instead, it provides a full inventory.
Support both ramdisks, with IPA being preferred.

Closes-Bug: #1497213

subject: Fix state computation incorrect
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-24 14:39:02.000000000', 'files': ['congress/tests/datasources/test_datasource_driver.py', 'congress/datasources/datasource_utils.py'], 'message': "Fix state computation incorrect

The Resource of oslo-incubator is used as the
super class of client object in novaclient and
cinderclient, but the implemented of __eq__ method
don't match the semantics of object equal. Check
equal between two objects by using obj1 == obj2,
that will always be True if the objects have the
same id, even if they have the different other
attribute value. The issue had been traced by
oslo-incubator bug/1499369, fix it in Congress side
as temporary workaround in order to avoid the issue
exist in stable/liberty branch.

Change-Id: I4304c32432dc1f813377c60704f817b4f3020da2
Closes-Bug: #1499065
"}]
commit_message:
Fix state computation incorrect

The Resource of oslo-incubator is used as the
super class of client object in novaclient and
cinderclient, but the implemented of __eq__ method
don't match the semantics of object equal. Check
equal between two objects by using obj1 == obj2,
that will always be True if the objects have the
same id, even if they have the different other
attribute value. The issue had been traced by
oslo-incubator bug/1499369, fix it in Congress side
as temporary workaround in order to avoid the issue
exist in stable/liberty branch.

Change-Id: I4304c32432dc1f813377c60704f817b4f3020da2
Closes-Bug: #1499065

commit_message:
Add alembic migrations for the inspector database

This patch adds a new command ironic-inspector-dbsync which can be used
to sync the ironic inspector database using alembic migrations. It adds
a migration to match the current required db schema.

Change-Id: I21188b3f5003c8ab43d82903473e2a6ef7f755a0
Closes-Bug: #1495620

commit_message:
Remove the voting restriction

Based on feedback in this review [1] we want to remove the
restriction on voting on guidelines. That restriction was
a hold over from a Summit discussion when we didn't really
know how everything would work out. It's simply not necessary
at this point.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/213876/3/doc/source/process.rst

Change-Id: I842a365f3bc5d23b39039525d315194b3344ff04

commit_message:
Add a description of {network_label} of Compute V2.1 API "Show IP details"

- A description of of {network_label} is missing, so add it.

- A current URI is "/v2/{tenant_id}/servers/{server_id}/ips/{id}".
  A name "{id}" is not appropriate, so change it to {network_label}.
  And change a short description so that it includes a term 'network label'.

For details, please see http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-compute-v2.1.html#show-ip.

Change-Id: I3d6c2c6087580db7f1af2e3c50486dcd702f75c6
Closes-Bug: #1496272

subject: guru_meditation_report: Use SIGUSR2 instead of SIGUSR1
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1297, 'name': 'Joshua Harlow', 'email': 'jxharlow@godaddy.com', 'username': 'harlowja'}, {'_account_id': 1669, 'name': 'Julien Danjou', 'display_name': 'jd', 'email': 'julien@danjou.info', 'username': 'jdanjou'}, {'_account_id': 1779, 'name': 'Daniel Berrange', 'email': 'berrange@redhat.com', 'username': 'berrange'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6601, 'name': 'James Carey', 'email': 'jecarey@yerac.com', 'username': 'jecarey'}, {'_account_id': 6962, 'name': 'Kashyap Chamarthy', 'email': 'kchamart@redhat.com', 'username': 'kashyapc'}, {'_account_id': 9107, 'name': 'Victor Stinner', 'email': 'vstinner@redhat.com', 'username': 'haypo'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-14 14:51:55.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_reports/tests/test_guru_meditation_report.py', 'oslo_reports/guru_meditation_report.py'], 'message': "guru_meditation_report: Use SIGUSR2 instead of SIGUSR1

Currently the setup_autorun() method expects the user-defined signal,
SIGUSR1, to generate Guru Meditation Report upon killing a Nova Compute
process, while supplying the said signal.

However, testing in a DevStack environment, manually attempting to kill
a Nova Compute process with SIGUSR1 [kill -s USR1 `pgrep nova-compute`]
does not result in the process being terminated, and no error report is
generated.

It turns out[*] that SIGUSR1 is used by Apache 'mod_wsgi'.

Using, the other user-defined signal, SIGUSR2 resolves this issue (i.e.
'nova-compute' process is terminated, and the Guru Meditation Report is
generated successfully).

So, use the signal USR2 instead of USR1.  Also, update the corresponding
tests.

DocImpact: With this patch merged, to generate a successful Guru
           Meditation Report, supply the signal USR2 while killing a
           Nova Compute process [`kill -s USR2 `pgrep nova-compute`].

[*] https://code.google.com/p/modwsgi/wiki/ConfigurationDirectives#WSGIRestrictSignal

Change-Id: I9d3b6079ba2cca41fe4723723a6f80b2c3c0b9c0
"}]
commit_message:
guru_meditation_report: Use SIGUSR2 instead of SIGUSR1

Currently the setup_autorun() method expects the user-defined signal,
SIGUSR1, to generate Guru Meditation Report upon killing a Nova Compute
process, while supplying the said signal.

However, testing in a DevStack environment, manually attempting to kill
a Nova Compute process with SIGUSR1 [kill -s USR1 `pgrep nova-compute`]
does not result in the process being terminated, and no error report is
generated.

It turns out[*] that SIGUSR1 is used by Apache 'mod_wsgi'.

Using, the other user-defined signal, SIGUSR2 resolves this issue (i.e.
'nova-compute' process is terminated, and the Guru Meditation Report is
generated successfully).

So, use the signal USR2 instead of USR1.  Also, update the corresponding
tests.

DocImpact: With this patch merged, to generate a successful Guru
           Meditation Report, supply the signal USR2 while killing a
           Nova Compute process [`kill -s USR2 `pgrep nova-compute`].

[*] https://code.google.com/p/modwsgi/wiki/ConfigurationDirectives#WSGIRestrictSignal

Change-Id: I9d3b6079ba2cca41fe4723723a6f80b2c3c0b9c0

subject: Fix a response body in "Compute v2 List addresses by network"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-24 12:48:34.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/src/wadls/compute-api/src/v2/api_samples/public.xml', 'api-ref/src/wadls/compute-api/src/v2/api_samples/public.json'], 'message': 'Fix a response body in "Compute v2 List addresses by network"

Fix a response body, which contains a "network label" such
a "public".

A response body of "Compute v2 List addresses by network" API
should have a "network label" parameter, not "id" and "ip"
parameters.

For details, please see http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-compute-v2.html#getNetworkAddresses.

Change-Id: I40b46e5ad744636a56e801df917d6ab37a90c1f0
Closes-Bug: #1499320
'}]
commit_message:
Fix a response body in "Compute v2 List addresses by network"

Fix a response body, which contains a "network label" such
a "public".

A response body of "Compute v2 List addresses by network" API
should have a "network label" parameter, not "id" and "ip"
parameters.

For details, please see http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-compute-v2.html#getNetworkAddresses.

Change-Id: I40b46e5ad744636a56e801df917d6ab37a90c1f0
Closes-Bug: #1499320

commit_message:
Make sure we can and do add subnets to routers

When you create a router, it makes almost no sense to not also attach
a subnet. Support both a one-stop-shop as well as calling each thing
individually.

Change-Id: I3860e54c965871a546efa782860df48e45d0f1fb

commit_message:
Use the get_auth function from occ

os-client-config now knows how to turn auth parameters into
auth objects. Use that, so that we're not carrying local
logic for it.

Also, this lets us remove our ironic-specific hacks around
auth and whatnot.

Change-Id: I436b7619f09911d131f380dd103138c8ff52c0b4
Depends-On: Ia1a1a4adb4dcefed5d7607082e026ca7361f394d

commit_message:
Allow creating externally accessible networks

Add an option to create_network() that lets the user create a
network that is externally accessible. By default, they will
NOT be externally accessible, since this may require special
privileges.

Change-Id: Ic9a3d05ac15399e55fa078b61fdb454ee9f56e69

commit_message:
Fail to create node when port is None

I used examples/profiles/nova_server.yaml to create node, but failed
because 'None' value of port. As port is optional param, we should del
port from creation kwargs when it's None.

Closes-Bug: #1498362
Change-Id: Ic9dff73da1d476d74a5e7027e40cab7824163903

subject: Adding multi-node test case for ML2 driver verification
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-04-27 18:22:33.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/test_network_multi_node.py', 'etc/tempest.conf.sample', 'tempest/config.py'], 'message': 'Adding multi-node test case for ML2 driver verification

    The Neutron ML2 driver will create a VLAN, when configured for VLAN, on the
    underlying network element when the first virtual machine (VM) is attached
    to a network/compute host.  Conversely, the ML2 driver will delete
    the VLAN associated with a network/compute host when the last VM is
    removed from that network/compute host.

    This test is designed for a multi-node OpenStack deployment
    with the goal of creating the maximum number of network create and
    delete events given the available resources.

    The test does the following:

    * Creates Aggregates/Zones with a one to one mapping of compute host
      to zone.  This allows the test to place a VM on a particular compute
      host.
    * Create networks based on the number of VMs and compute hosts.
    * Create VMs and distribute them on networks.
    * Selects one of the VMs as a ping source to send ping packets to each
      of the other (east/west) VMs using both the floating IP and the fixed
      IP address.  The number of ping packets and the size of the ping
      packets are controlled by the following tempest
      configuration variables:
       - test_packet_count: The number of packets to send for each packet size
       - test_packet_sizes: A list of packet sizes used during testing
      The packet and byte counts are verified for each ping test sequence.
    * The VMs are then deleted, not as part of test cleanup but to allow the
      network delete events from the ML2 driver to be captured and verified.

Change-Id: Idb8889a0b4fdf2d1342d521f7137894a5eab12d7
'}]
commit_message:
Adding multi-node test case for ML2 driver verification

    The Neutron ML2 driver will create a VLAN, when configured for VLAN, on the
    underlying network element when the first virtual machine (VM) is attached
    to a network/compute host.  Conversely, the ML2 driver will delete
    the VLAN associated with a network/compute host when the last VM is
    removed from that network/compute host.

    This test is designed for a multi-node OpenStack deployment
    with the goal of creating the maximum number of network create and
    delete events given the available resources.

    The test does the following:

    * Creates Aggregates/Zones with a one to one mapping of compute host
      to zone.  This allows the test to place a VM on a particular compute
      host.
    * Create networks based on the number of VMs and compute hosts.
    * Create VMs and distribute them on networks.
    * Selects one of the VMs as a ping source to send ping packets to each
      of the other (east/west) VMs using both the floating IP and the fixed
      IP address.  The number of ping packets and the size of the ping
      packets are controlled by the following tempest
      configuration variables:
       - test_packet_count: The number of packets to send for each packet size
       - test_packet_sizes: A list of packet sizes used during testing
      The packet and byte counts are verified for each ping test sequence.
    * The VMs are then deleted, not as part of test cleanup but to allow the
      network delete events from the ML2 driver to be captured and verified.

Change-Id: Idb8889a0b4fdf2d1342d521f7137894a5eab12d7

commit_message:
Fix NoneType error when calling MetricsWeigher

Given that dict comprehensions don't allow to have None as a list, we had
a problem with the Ironic gate-ironic-inspector-dsvm job because
host_state.metrics was set to None by default.

Adding a unittest to make sure we don't regress.

Closes-Bug: #1499271
Change-Id: I6e3104bbd9b9865ec2dcc724c2f56da6d0b2b687

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-23 20:25:15.000000000', 'files': ['nova/volume/cinder.py'], 'message': "Deprecate cinder.cross_az_attach option

Introduced in 1504cbc5d4a27695fa663f0b0f3f7b48745bdb45 in Grizzly, the
use cases around this option are unclear but there have been several
bugs related to it.

For example, 6060888b58db42eea826939852838f9e1c204d2c changed boot from
volume to pass the server instance availability zone to cinder when
creating the volume.  However, if that same AZ does not exist in Cinder,
the volume create request will fail - which is bug 1496235.

Cinder works around this with b85d2812a8256ff82934d150dbc4909e041d8b31
using a config option to allow falling back to a default Cinder AZ if
the one requested does not exist.  By default this fallback is disabled
though.

It also sounds like availability zones in Cinder were an artifact from
when Cinder was split out from the nova-volume service, but Cinder AZ
use cases are also unclear.  And it's also unclear what the relationship
is between AZs in Nova and Cinder.

So given the problems here and the lack of a clear use case to justify
having this configuration option in tree, along with it's added
complexity, deprecate the option for removal.

Related-Bug: #1496235
Related-Bug: #1380780
Related-Bug: #1489575
Related-Bug: #1497253

Change-Id: I52cd3d8867d3b35f5caba377302bfc52c112f1d6
"}]
commit_message:
Deprecate cinder.cross_az_attach option

Introduced in 1504cbc5d4a27695fa663f0b0f3f7b48745bdb45 in Grizzly, the
use cases around this option are unclear but there have been several
bugs related to it.

For example, 6060888b58db42eea826939852838f9e1c204d2c changed boot from
volume to pass the server instance availability zone to cinder when
creating the volume.  However, if that same AZ does not exist in Cinder,
the volume create request will fail - which is bug 1496235.

Cinder works around this with b85d2812a8256ff82934d150dbc4909e041d8b31
using a config option to allow falling back to a default Cinder AZ if
the one requested does not exist.  By default this fallback is disabled
though.

It also sounds like availability zones in Cinder were an artifact from
when Cinder was split out from the nova-volume service, but Cinder AZ
use cases are also unclear.  And it's also unclear what the relationship
is between AZs in Nova and Cinder.

So given the problems here and the lack of a clear use case to justify
having this configuration option in tree, along with it's added
complexity, deprecate the option for removal.

Related-Bug: #1496235
Related-Bug: #1380780
Related-Bug: #1489575
Related-Bug: #1497253

Change-Id: I52cd3d8867d3b35f5caba377302bfc52c112f1d6

commit_message:
Py3k compliance: check for bytes when making a string

When faking stdout in tests we must account for the case when
"strings" might be bytes, which python3 cares about.

Closes-Bug: #1499004
(cherry picked from commit fcf289797c063088f9003359dfd1c7d4f41ed5ef)

commit_message:
Rework policy management

Previously, global object is used.
And right after horizon is started to use the same global object for managing policies,
everything get ruined.

This commit mostly leaves same names for methods, but now local object is created
for policy validation

Change-Id: I438192632d2779fd1c0a628df7645d09a99610ce
Closes-Bug: #1466332

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-24 13:11:55.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/os_cinder/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_cinder/tasks/cinder_lvm_config.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_cinder/tasks/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_cinder/templates/cinder.conf.j2'], 'message': 'Use Cinder-specific lvm.conf with LVM backend

Currently os_cinder manages the file /etc/lvm/lvm.conf. When
cinder-volume is deployed on bare-metal this can cause a conflict with
the openstack_hosts role.

This commit updates the os_cinder role so that LVM backends use an
lvm.conf file that is located in /etc/cinder. The task files included in
main.yml are reordered so that the lvm.conf file is created before the
handlers are flushed.

Change-Id: Ie57b808e8b159c28e5942952530b1ede3397f29e
Closes-bug: 1488532
'}]
commit_message:
Use Cinder-specific lvm.conf with LVM backend

Currently os_cinder manages the file /etc/lvm/lvm.conf. When
cinder-volume is deployed on bare-metal this can cause a conflict with
the openstack_hosts role.

This commit updates the os_cinder role so that LVM backends use an
lvm.conf file that is located in /etc/cinder. The task files included in
main.yml are reordered so that the lvm.conf file is created before the
handlers are flushed.

Change-Id: Ie57b808e8b159c28e5942952530b1ede3397f29e
Closes-bug: 1488532

The ; separator allows providing parameters to a type not separating
type options. This means that in strict type checks like those performed

'}]
commit_message:
Fix Accept header in SAML2 requests

The ; separator allows providing parameters to a type not separating
type options. This means that in strict type checks like those performed
by mod_auth_mellon the check for accept type fails.

Change-Id: Ieeaa74b304921daef68497fec77cc6629ab2f0a2
Closes-Bug: #1488722
(cherry picked from commit e0276c65364bcb8a4a3fe1ad1c91899b1325836c)

commit_message:
Update proliantutils version required for L release

This commit updates the proliantutils version required in Ironic
to 2.1.5 for L release. This version of proliantutils includes the
following functionality in addition to bug fixes:
* Enablement of logging
* Enablemnet of RIS interfaces in Gen9 for virtual media and boot
  device related operations.

Change-Id: I0421809e9001570790c6268e1b9b3d05b33198a9

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 12767, 'name': 'Craige McWhirter', 'email': 'craige@mcwhirter.io', 'username': 'craige'}, {'_account_id': 13431, 'name': 'Evgeny Antyshev', 'email': 'eantyshev@gmail.com', 'username': 'eantyshev'}, {'_account_id': 16272, 'name': 'Clint Adams', 'email': 'clint@gcfm.net', 'username': 'clint'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-18 04:03:45.000000000', 'files': ['functions.sh'], 'message': 'Generic RPM installation detection

This is an alternative to I77957e9a107f0b1aeef81fb6a98e9840954d2a44
which makes detection of RPM-based distros a little more generic.

After some thought, this seems to be a pretty low-level and generic
way to match what we want right now; i.e. centos, fedora & related
rhel-based distros like cloudos).

The will all have a /etc/*-release file managed by RPM, and all
non-relevant systems (debian/ubuntu) will not (even if they somehow
managed to get rpm installed, for alien or something).

Change-Id: If2bd38df2a9720aa9288aa522b7587136e900d93
'}]
commit_message:
Generic RPM installation detection

This is an alternative to I77957e9a107f0b1aeef81fb6a98e9840954d2a44
which makes detection of RPM-based distros a little more generic.

After some thought, this seems to be a pretty low-level and generic
way to match what we want right now; i.e. centos, fedora & related
rhel-based distros like cloudos).

The will all have a /etc/*-release file managed by RPM, and all
non-relevant systems (debian/ubuntu) will not (even if they somehow
managed to get rpm installed, for alien or something).

Change-Id: If2bd38df2a9720aa9288aa522b7587136e900d93

commit_message:
implement os-endpoint-type parameter

* Allow end-user to configure os-endpoint-type in service_credentials
  ceilometer.conf.
* Also bring consistent how we manage empty parameters in the class, and
  use undef when possible.
* Actually run the ceilometer-agent-auth tests (never ran before).

Change-Id: I9b7e8a6058a4e9bf08f479dcb7d25dd416299407

subject: image build: prepare for different generation methods
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-09-24 11:30:30.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_image.py', 'tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_image/test_overcloud_image.py'], 'message': "image build: prepare for different generation methods

Isolate the bits creating the command line invocations to
disk-image-create/ramdisk-image-create into a small class;
introduce a new parameter to decide which method to use for generating
the images, with the only value of 'dib', representing the current
diskimage-builder method.

Force the use of dib in TestOvercloudImageBuild, and mock the methods of
DibImageBuilder.

Change-Id: I9287cd9375fbc496f3d2bb570a61cd320a2e451b
"}]
commit_message:
image build: prepare for different generation methods

Isolate the bits creating the command line invocations to
disk-image-create/ramdisk-image-create into a small class;
introduce a new parameter to decide which method to use for generating
the images, with the only value of 'dib', representing the current
diskimage-builder method.

Force the use of dib in TestOvercloudImageBuild, and mock the methods of
DibImageBuilder.

Change-Id: I9287cd9375fbc496f3d2bb570a61cd320a2e451b

subject: ironic-agent element to output a .kernel file
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1926, 'name': 'Derek Higgins', 'email': 'derekh@redhat.com', 'username': 'derekh'}, {'_account_id': 6488, 'name': 'Clint Byrum', 'email': 'clint@fewbar.com', 'username': 'clint-fewbar'}, {'_account_id': 6773, 'name': 'Lucas Alvares Gomes', 'email': 'lucasagomes@gmail.com', 'username': 'lucasagomes'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 12715, 'name': 'John Trowbridge', 'email': 'trown@redhat.com', 'username': 'trown'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-09-23 23:03:36.000000000', 'files': ['elements/ironic-agent/README.rst', 'elements/ironic-agent/cleanup.d/99-ramdisk-create'], 'message': 'ironic-agent element to output a .kernel file

The ironic-agent element is created using the disk-image-create utility
(even being a ramdisk) and outputs a .vmlinuz file for the kernel
(different than the ramdisk-image-create which outputs a .kernel file
for the kernel). This is inconsistent and make scripting against the
diskimage-builder more complicated if one wants to support different
types of ramdisk.

This patch creates a hard link for the .vmlinuz file to a .kernel file
at the end of the process (to keep backward compatibility) and print a
deprecation message.

Depends-On: I81400305f166d62aa4612aab54602abb8178b64c
Change-Id: I476f9ec9ec4206ece0261eaaf2b4182c6bcbd802
Closes-Bug: #1482606
'}]
commit_message:
ironic-agent element to output a .kernel file

The ironic-agent element is created using the disk-image-create utility
(even being a ramdisk) and outputs a .vmlinuz file for the kernel
(different than the ramdisk-image-create which outputs a .kernel file
for the kernel). This is inconsistent and make scripting against the
diskimage-builder more complicated if one wants to support different
types of ramdisk.

This patch creates a hard link for the .vmlinuz file to a .kernel file
at the end of the process (to keep backward compatibility) and print a
deprecation message.

Depends-On: I81400305f166d62aa4612aab54602abb8178b64c
Change-Id: I476f9ec9ec4206ece0261eaaf2b4182c6bcbd802
Closes-Bug: #1482606

commit_message:
Support dhcp metadata service for all networks

Vendors implementing Neutron L3 API in their devices may not be able to provide
metadata server access via the Neutron router. In such cases we want to allow
the metadata service as done for non-isolated networks segments.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I5f6ee9788717c3d4f1f2e2a4b9734fdd8dd92b40
Closes-Bug:#1483939

revisions:

In some cases, the cluster_id property of node object will be set

Closes-Bug: #1497165
Closes-Bug: #1497173
'}]
commit_message:
Use correct cluster_id in NodeAction.execute

In some cases, the cluster_id property of node object will be set
to None during node action progress. Therefore, we should use orignal
cluster_id value of node to do related check in NodeAction.execute.
This patch fixes related issues.

Change-Id: I4f2b0f7288a02eaeb4ffb8b01d05259790449f70
Closes-Bug: #1497165
Closes-Bug: #1497173

subject: Huawei driver add check before use a QoS
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-24 06:06:52.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/huawei/constants.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_huawei_drivers.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/huawei/rest_client.py'], 'message': 'Huawei driver add check before use a QoS

One QoS in Huawei storage array can contain at most 64 LUNs.
Do a check before adding LUN to QoS, if the number of the
LUNs in the QoS is already equal or larger than 64, then
this QoS should not be used.

Change-Id: I62a2fe2b8dda390bb5a5729a1141957b638816d9
Closed-Bug: #1498773
'}]
commit_message:
Huawei driver add check before use a QoS

One QoS in Huawei storage array can contain at most 64 LUNs.
Do a check before adding LUN to QoS, if the number of the
LUNs in the QoS is already equal or larger than 64, then
this QoS should not be used.

Change-Id: I62a2fe2b8dda390bb5a5729a1141957b638816d9
Closed-Bug: #1498773

commit_message:
Make bay.api_address contains protocol

After implementing TLS support for kubernetes, template_definition
only know how to access to bay and which protocol is used.
This patch makes template_definition set protocol to bay.api_address.

Change-Id: Iaebb71a8d61581638bf3779f7e71408e9d92d44f
Partially-Implements: bp secure-kubernetes

commit_message:
Change definition of Certificate Authority Model for no soft deletes

The CA model was defined to use soft delete, but none of the code
accessing the database treated it that way.  This commit changes
that definition to hard delete the CAs when they are deleted.

Change-Id: I0d39175192cf8a86bcd2bd00020001b9f56259f6
Closes-bug: #1499103

commit_message:
Add check to validators that SubCA's project id matches order's project id

A subCA is owned by a project and should only be used by a user with
a role in that project.  This change adds a check that forces a 403
error indicating authorization issues if a user from a different
project posts and order referencing a subCA.

Change-Id: Ia34c4b0d48f605c491b9604099e8715cb9eff316
Closes-bug: #1498289
Partially-implements: blueprint add-cas

commit_message:
Add i18n _ import to cimc common

For some reason this wasn't picked up by pep8 checks or any unit tests
importing the module, even in system testing this didn't cause any
problems. However trying to import this module from another piece of
python outside of ironic, flagged that common didn't import the _
function.

Change-Id: Ide9d79095ba4486359c91f3127f6df8d9576245c
Closes-Bug: #1499284

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-21 14:14:31.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/netapp/dataontap/fakes.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/dataontap/client/client_base.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/dataontap/nfs_cmode.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/netapp/dataontap/test_nfs_cmode.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_netapp_nfs.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/dataontap/client/client_cmode.py'], 'message': 'NetApp volume/snapshot delete performance fix

cDOT NFS NetApp drivers back cinder volumes with array-side files and
use array-side cloning techniques when creating snapshots and when
creating volumes from glance images.  Customers have experienced
performance issues on the array when deleting many of these in
in quick succession, especially for large volumes.

This commit addresses these performance issues by overriding parent
class volume and snapshot delete methods, which use OS "rm" command to
delete volume backing files, with methods that use DOT API to delete
these files, and which invoke the optimized file deletion engine
available in DOT 8.3.

Closes-bug: 1497258
Change-Id: I44428d0840f6584f93ca214a2a607869b345554c
'}]
commit_message:
NetApp volume/snapshot delete performance fix

cDOT NFS NetApp drivers back cinder volumes with array-side files and
use array-side cloning techniques when creating snapshots and when
creating volumes from glance images.  Customers have experienced
performance issues on the array when deleting many of these in
in quick succession, especially for large volumes.

This commit addresses these performance issues by overriding parent
class volume and snapshot delete methods, which use OS "rm" command to
delete volume backing files, with methods that use DOT API to delete
these files, and which invoke the optimized file deletion engine
available in DOT 8.3.

Closes-bug: 1497258
Change-Id: I44428d0840f6584f93ca214a2a607869b345554c

commit_message:
Adds virtualenv in global-requirements.txt

Devstack fails to build on stable/kilo because requirements is trying to
update pbr wich has virtualenv requirement; this dependency is not
present in global-requirements.

Change-Id: I45f211d56d5f4c5a961fe5fbe3063815f8eea07f
Closes-Bug: #1499300

commit_message:
Add module reset logic for librarian

This change adds the ability to do a reset or an update with the
updates_modules.sh script. The reset will do a git reset on the upstream
module if there are any manual changes. The update will do a librarian
update which will checkout the version specified in the Puppetfile.
These changes allow for better development testing as a developer can
test manual changes and version changes via the update_modules.sh
script. Additionally the fuel_noop_tests.rb script has been updated to
support the reset flag for developer testing.

Change-Id: Ib21b3ea210b554e1f58bb7a80453989ba8206104
Closes-Bug: 1489542

commit_message:
Remove test of project against buildable list

This list should never have existed, If we are not capable
of building a package for a particular project then it wont
be in rdoinfo and map-project-name wont return anything.

Change-Id: I0c4e58851c36019ea11ef5fb2605bb854bac1de9

commit_message:
Fix a unit test for create instance

The test_launch_form_keystone_exception test method calls the
handle method of the LaunchInstance class. Changes made to
the handle method in [1] introduced a new neutron api call
that was not being mocked out, causing an unexpected exception
in the _cleanup_ports_on_failed_vm_launch function of the
create_instance module, while running the
test_launch_form_keystone_exception unit test

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/202347/

Closes-Bug: 1492065
Change-Id: Ib3ad9146339a60b8d53e849091abf6a9bb64de93
(cherry picked from commit 34ab52966d2bc7550fc2a8de04ad27267ce33f36)

commit_message:
Enable VPN test cases

With the gate hook changes from Ieeaca1375d68705509f4e05f10cb35c0fa0b9582 and
new jobs from I2db939bf99288c0cdec06cdd49fec3bdc72e5253, this commit does
several things:

    * Moves test modules to tests/functional/core/
    * Moves VPN test cases to new module & places in tests/functional/adv-svcs
    * Modifies tox.ini to support 'functional' and 'functional-adv-svcs' test

This commit will be used to test the experimental jobs, one that runs the
same tests as before, one that runs VPN tests using the VPN DevStack plugin
via the gate-hook.sh.

Modified post test hook so that test results are properly created (was not
seeing results from testr, prior to this).

Goal is to place all advanced services into tests/functional/adv-svcs/ and
use plugins, as needed in the gate hook.

Change-Id: I1e3d19e51a1cbd1bc947bbf9927260cd4d73841a
Depends-On: I2db939bf99288c0cdec06cdd49fec3bdc72e5253
Partial-Bug: 1484148

subject: Enhance start/stop concurrency race condition fix
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-09-16 12:54:45.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/_utils.py', 'oslo_messaging/tests/rpc/test_server.py', 'oslo_messaging/server.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py'], 'message': 'Enhance start/stop concurrency race condition fix

We want to ensure start have really finish before the caller
use stop to not go into weird driver state.

Inteads of raise RuntimeError or just printing warning, we
now use a lock to protect the state change of the server.

So stop will just wait that the server finish to start before
stopping.

This also removes the need to start/stop the server from the
same thread just to fix the state consistency of drivers when
thread or eventlet executor is used.

Change-Id: Ia7346f6cc0bbe8631a2e3318c7031b34ab1ec510
'}]
commit_message:
Enhance start/stop concurrency race condition fix

We want to ensure start have really finish before the caller
use stop to not go into weird driver state.

Inteads of raise RuntimeError or just printing warning, we
now use a lock to protect the state change of the server.

So stop will just wait that the server finish to start before
stopping.

This also removes the need to start/stop the server from the
same thread just to fix the state consistency of drivers when
thread or eventlet executor is used.

Change-Id: Ia7346f6cc0bbe8631a2e3318c7031b34ab1ec510

commit_message:
Add SASL configuration options for AMQP 1.0 driver.

Proton's SASL implementation provides several different configuration
options, such as the permitted mechanism set and the configuration
file.  This patch adds support for configuring these items.

Change-Id: Icf59643a6d557e3d91947664afedd420c9522fd8
Closes-Bug: #1495969

commit_message:
Add default domain into openrc

According to docs default domain is needed for keystone V3 auth:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/python-openstackclient/authentication.html

+ Avoid annoying "warning: already initialized constant" message
Related-Bug: #1479382

commit_message:
Don't scan /var/lib/ceph with updatedb

/var/lib/ceph usually contains a big set of files and significant IO
slowdown may be observed during indexing, which actually is useless.

Closes-Bug: #1469993
Change-Id: I6995334867ba486ad036d1fd32492cf78e6a9ce1

commit_message:
Unsubscribe target listener when leaving

We are using Redis-based persistent name storage, so
unrelated references should be cleaned when listener
doesn't exist any more.

Change-Id: I464a17d6de1d1679244db51f54f620017da071b3

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-23 10:22:00.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/openstacklib/lib/puppet/provider/openstack.rb'], 'message': 'Avoid retry for openstack remove resource

The retry function for openstack client introduced
regressions where a slow keystone response causes
timeouts and subsequent retries meet a race
condition, trying to remove a resource that was
already removed, failing deployment.

Create and remove are not idempotent, and should
not be retried.

Change-Id: I713f773629646698e1da87bb9be7cb9ede34d148
Closes-Bug: #1497148
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid retry for openstack remove resource

The retry function for openstack client introduced
regressions where a slow keystone response causes
timeouts and subsequent retries meet a race
condition, trying to remove a resource that was
already removed, failing deployment.

Create and remove are not idempotent, and should
not be retried.

Change-Id: I713f773629646698e1da87bb9be7cb9ede34d148
Closes-Bug: #1497148

Related-bug: #1493732

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-22 17:36:53.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_plugin.py', 'neutron/db/l3_dvrscheduler_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/scheduler/test_l3_agent_scheduler.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'message': "Descheduling DVR routers when ports are unbound from VM

commit_message:
Descheduling DVR routers when ports are unbound from VM

When a VM is deleted, the DVR port used by the VM could be unbound
from the compute node. When it is unbounded, it is no longer
in use on the node. Currently the unbind doesn't trigger a check
to determine whether the DVR router can be unscheduled from the
L3-agent running on the compute node. This patch makes the check
and unschedule the router, if necessary.

Conflicts:
        neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_plugin.py

Closes-Bug: 1489184
Change-Id: I882e0682bfc7695b3b23e36eb4d7e35a5d19748e
(cherry picked from commit d5a8074ec3c67ed68e64a96827da990f1c34e10f)

commit_message:
Reset the vagrant base image to puppetlabs/centos-7.0-64-puppet

The centos/7 image does not contain guest additions which breaks shared
folder functionality when not using NFS.

Change-Id: If67868bd98ee9bd793f151ee7463d399305eb21b

subject: Fix more tests in python34 gate
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-09-24 08:27:43.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/workflow/data_flow.py', 'mistral/workbook/base.py', 'mistral/workbook/v2/workflows.py', 'mistral/tests/base.py', 'mistral/db/v2/sqlalchemy/models.py', 'mistral/engine/utils.py'], 'message': "Fix more tests in python34 gate

Patch contains fixes for following errors:
- 'filter' object is not subscriptable (fix in mistral/tests/base.py)
- Unicode-objects must be encoded before hashing (fix in
mistral/db/v2/sqlalchemy/models.py)
- 'dict' object has no attribute 'itervalues' (fixes in
mistral/workbook/v2/workflows.py and mistral/workflow/data_flow.py)
- 'dict_items' object does not support indexing (fix in
mistral/workbook/base.py)
- object.__new__(dict_keys) is not safe, use dict_keys.__new__()
(fix in mistral/engine/utils.py)

Partial-Bug: #1378537

Change-Id: Ic9ecae34cce9b1190cef4fd53d2012117002a4c2
"}]
commit_message:
Fix more tests in python34 gate

Patch contains fixes for following errors:
- 'filter' object is not subscriptable (fix in mistral/tests/base.py)
- Unicode-objects must be encoded before hashing (fix in
mistral/db/v2/sqlalchemy/models.py)
- 'dict' object has no attribute 'itervalues' (fixes in
mistral/workbook/v2/workflows.py and mistral/workflow/data_flow.py)
- 'dict_items' object does not support indexing (fix in
mistral/workbook/base.py)
- object.__new__(dict_keys) is not safe, use dict_keys.__new__()
(fix in mistral/engine/utils.py)

Partial-Bug: #1378537

Change-Id: Ic9ecae34cce9b1190cef4fd53d2012117002a4c2

commit_message:
Use parameter_defaults everywhere

This usage of parameters in utils.create_environment_file got missed as
part of the switch to parameter_defaults:
I2722e118abde1cea6210148b16ac1ed3d9f235d8

This was causing all the scale parameters to be set to 1, even if you
specified a higher number on the command line.

Change-Id: If7367c365c59ca0200dc7b643d8bbdfc7efa48fe

commit_message:
Remove Debug parameter from overcloud deploy

Overcloud deploy command passed debug=True to Heat by default.
This parameter was removed in order to make debug mode controllable
via templates.

Change-Id: I3706d9c04ee736c01759fce4f616db3d29d41582
Closes-Bug: rhbz#1259084

subject: Return default domain for admin
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-15 19:26:06.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/common/controller.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_identity.py'], 'message': 'Return default domain for admin

When admin token is used several operations fail to extract token information
from context as it is empty.
This patch adds a check to V3Controller to return default domain if current
user is admin.

Change-Id: I4f1c5a0918f2bf9f8ca433075f8120fd34724709
Closes-Bug: 1493126
'}]
commit_message:
Return default domain for admin

When admin token is used several operations fail to extract token information
from context as it is empty.
This patch adds a check to V3Controller to return default domain if current
user is admin.

Change-Id: I4f1c5a0918f2bf9f8ca433075f8120fd34724709
Closes-Bug: 1493126

subject: Add jsonutils.dump_as_bytes() function for py3
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-09-23 13:23:56.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_serialization/tests/test_jsonutils.py', 'oslo_serialization/jsonutils.py'], 'message': "Add jsonutils.dump_as_bytes() function for py3

The jsonutils.dumps() function returns bytes on Python 2 and Unicode
oon Python 3. In some cases, we always want bytes. For example, a
HTTP body must be bytes. This function avoids an condition call to
.encode() depending on the type or on the Python version.

For example:

    body = jsonutils.dumps(data)
    if isinstance(body, six.text_type):
        body = body.encode('utf-8')

can be replaced with:

    body = jsonutils.dump_as_bytes(data)

Change-Id: Ib9d8f1309982762b54d8a91b1f24f64d0ae6723a
"}]
commit_message:
Add jsonutils.dump_as_bytes() function for py3

The jsonutils.dumps() function returns bytes on Python 2 and Unicode
oon Python 3. In some cases, we always want bytes. For example, a
HTTP body must be bytes. This function avoids an condition call to
.encode() depending on the type or on the Python version.

For example:

    body = jsonutils.dumps(data)
    if isinstance(body, six.text_type):
        body = body.encode('utf-8')

can be replaced with:

    body = jsonutils.dump_as_bytes(data)

Change-Id: Ib9d8f1309982762b54d8a91b1f24f64d0ae6723a

commit_message:
Fix error response when denying snapshot creation

If we try to create snapshot from share that is not snapshottable
we expect error that it is not possible and proper description for it.
Now we get some abstract message
"ERROR: Unable to process the contained instructions".

So, make API provide proper information about error.

Change-Id: I16a2f7c80102159c30f91af7e045e73ee3df7f89
Closes-Bug: #1496408

subject: Give instance default hostname if hostname is empty
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-24 07:36:37.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/test_utils.py', 'nova/utils.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': "Give instance default hostname if hostname is empty

Instance hostname is generated by displayname, currently, displayname
can be '----', and other Non-ASCII character such as Chinese characters,
sanitize_hostname will return empty in such cases.

This patch adds a helper function _default_host_name to give an instance
default name if sanitize_hostname returns empty hostname. And,
sanitize_hostname will truncated to 63 if the host name is too long.

Also Window, Linux, and Dnsmasq have different limitation:

Windows: 255 (net_bios limit to 15, but window will truncate it)
Linux: 64
Dnsmasq: 63

Due to nova-network will leverage dnsmasq to set hostname, so we chose
63.

Besides, added more test cases to cover sanitize_hostname.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1495388
Co-authored-by: Alex Xu <hejie.xu@intel.com>

(cherry picked from commit bc6f30de953303604625e84ad2345cfb595170d2)

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py
	nova/tests/unit/test_utils.py
	nova/utils.py

Change-Id: I3331e23ea7eb717abf2ef72aa79e6c65f1fffa47
"}]
commit_message:
Give instance default hostname if hostname is empty

Instance hostname is generated by displayname, currently, displayname
can be '----', and other Non-ASCII character such as Chinese characters,
sanitize_hostname will return empty in such cases.

This patch adds a helper function _default_host_name to give an instance
default name if sanitize_hostname returns empty hostname. And,
sanitize_hostname will truncated to 63 if the host name is too long.

Also Window, Linux, and Dnsmasq have different limitation:

Windows: 255 (net_bios limit to 15, but window will truncate it)
Linux: 64
Dnsmasq: 63

Due to nova-network will leverage dnsmasq to set hostname, so we chose
63.

Besides, added more test cases to cover sanitize_hostname.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1495388
Co-authored-by: Alex Xu <hejie.xu@intel.com>

(cherry picked from commit bc6f30de953303604625e84ad2345cfb595170d2)

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py
	nova/tests/unit/test_utils.py
	nova/utils.py

Change-Id: I3331e23ea7eb717abf2ef72aa79e6c65f1fffa47

commit_message:
Fix schema and template call for os.heat.stack profile

The current code has an override version of 'get_schema()' call and an
useless 'get_template()' call which has been removed a while ago. This
patch removes them so that 'profile-type-schema' can work for heat stack
profiles.

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-09-24 00:28:20.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/volume_base.py'], 'message': "Only fail Volume deletion in 'error_deleting' state

The volume may have been in the 'error' status before we attempted to
delete it, and there is no guarantee that it has moved to 'deleting' before
we query it again. We only want to fail if there is an error *after* we
call delete, which will put the volume into the 'error_deleting' state. We
now check for that state explicitly.

Change-Id: I7e205aef46f8dd35fd605eb768a3b05360f4d374
Closes-Bug: #1496445"}]
commit_message:
Only fail Volume deletion in 'error_deleting' state

The volume may have been in the 'error' status before we attempted to
delete it, and there is no guarantee that it has moved to 'deleting' before
we query it again. We only want to fail if there is an error *after* we
call delete, which will put the volume into the 'error_deleting' state. We
now check for that state explicitly.

Change-Id: I7e205aef46f8dd35fd605eb768a3b05360f4d374
Closes-Bug: #1496445

If there are multiple reseller prefixes, a COPY from one prefix

even though they don't use a service token.

This patch simply dissallows requests that attempt to copy between

commit_message:
Disallow cross-reseller COPY

If there are multiple reseller prefixes, a COPY from one prefix
to an account with another prefix only validates the source path.
So a user may overwrite an object in the SERVICE_ prefix account
even though they don't use a service token.

This patch simply dissallows requests that attempt to copy between
different reseller prefixes.

NOTE: there is proposed patch to move COPY into middleware. At that
point, the validation for cross-reseller copies may work correctly
"for free". If so, this patch can be undone at that stage.

Change-Id: Idcda54e7728458883d4d223e7e2d21a1a08253dc
Fixes: 1483007

commit_message:
Use 'wait_for_external_config' for customizations

The following CRs provide new mechanism for customizations
setup before master node bootstrap:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/214749/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/225132/

This patch adjusts system tests to use 'wait_for_external_config'
kernel parameter for customization of master node setup.

Change-Id: Ie89f544b9747255f7a4e75d42367a629fada8dfd

commit_message:
add tweaks::apache to modular/apache/apache.pp

 * "apachectl graceful" that is called in keystone.pp
   leads to apache hung if it  was previously started with
   "service apache2 start". And started sucessfully if it
   was started with "apachectl graceful".
 * Doing 60 sec sleep after apache reload. This sleep is needed
   in order to mark memcache servers as dead in keystone after
   reload. Otherwise 401 error might occur.
 * update noop tests

 Further more puppetlabs-apache starting from 1.5.0 version
 natively supports defining 'restart' command [1].

[1] https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-apache/commit/f1f554b57fd841adfcfcf263ed5afb2c4d958b09

Closes-Bug: #1493372

Change-Id: I44fdc65c6685041db6ac9d310f148736fc9ed430

subject: gate: use port 8041
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-09-22 14:11:23.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/settings'], 'message': 'gate: use port 8041

Currently in gate the API log are lost because we
run Gnocchi on port 80 without virtualhost and we
have no idea of how Apache is configured.

This change uses the port 8041 per default, so the devstack
plugin will create a virtualhost and logs will go in
/var/log/apache/gnocchi-XXX.

Change-Id: Id9cf55023c4b14a800af0cb893ca09f5f0afc85d
'}]
commit_message:
gate: use port 8041

Currently in gate the API log are lost because we
run Gnocchi on port 80 without virtualhost and we
have no idea of how Apache is configured.

This change uses the port 8041 per default, so the devstack
plugin will create a virtualhost and logs will go in
/var/log/apache/gnocchi-XXX.

Change-Id: Id9cf55023c4b14a800af0cb893ca09f5f0afc85d

murano-dashboard templates. This commit contains js block, that contains
and compresses all of the murano-dashboard js code. All js are moved
from individual pages to murano_base.html. This means, that
murano-dashboard js code has to behave nice, when put on a page, not

in DOM tree.
To achieve this the commit does the following:
* makes selectors more specific for 'environments-in-place.js'
